one_reviews_text: I wish the narrator's Nintendo would stop going off so much. It's pretty distracting :(

The 700 MB size offers quick downloads. The controls are super-easy and clearly marked on your VR "hands." High-resolution, photo-source rendering of a wide array of the most important planetary bodies ever discoverd in our solar system, along with the Sun and some other stars. Lots of readable facts and photos are offered to deepen one's visual appreciation. Every planetary object can be pulled "close" (right or left internal trigger on the remote), rotated (thumb sticks) and  examined with beautiful lightening, darkeining and surface/horizon effects as you turn "in" or "away" from the virtual Sun (a little bit awkward at times, you may have to twist your hands around in uncomfortable positions to fully utilize the display). Offers 2 ways on the dashboard, gravity assisted flyer and 0g "space walk," to fly around, by and into any display. Playful use of size perspectives with lots of opprtuinity to compare exotic planetary objects and stars with ones closest to Earth (always available on the virtual dahboard). Re-play  offers an all-access amount of "drop-in" points.

5 stars as-is, but what could make it 6?

1. Cross-section diagrams of the scientifically-proposed, internal layers for the major planetary objects... interactive? There is text talking about a "rain of diamonds" speculated in a layer of Jupiter's atmosphere. How cool would that be imagined in VR?

2. 3D planetary surface renderings, especially those sourced from the small pool of actual robotic lander's data and photos. Venera on Venus, Cassini-Huygens on Titan, a crawl across Mars with Opportunity, Curiostiy, Spirit?

Its not just blah blah blah facts, learned many new and interesting things about our solar system and its planets. I took multiple astronomy courses in college too. Its worth your money! oh and the graphics are on point.

review_title: The Titan of Solar System Education
one_reviews_text:
This app used to be good back on the Rift DK1.
And now it's better than ever. This is a mandatory experience for VR newcomers.
5/5 every time

review_title: I was in awe the whole time
one_reviews_text: I did the full tour and examined every bit of info available. I also did the quick tour onr Rift and Quest. This title is just fascinating and awe inspiring. If you are curious about the solar system and our tiny size in the universe, you must check this out. For $10 it is a steal.  I caught myself with my jaw dropped multiple times uttering things like holy f*** and j**** c*****....
review_feedback: Well that sounds like a great way to start 2020. :) Glad you liked it and thank you so much for the review!

one_reviews_text:
This has always been a fascinating and wonderful way to experience the wonders of our solar system, but the recent updates have improved pretty much every aspect and added a layer of really nice polish. The new tour guide is fantastic, and holding a planet in your hand to take a closer look is just fantastic.

100% recommended if you have even the slightest interest in space!

Really enjoyed this. Did the full tour and took over an hour, with lots of info and imagery to soak in. If you have any interest in space and our solar system this one is worth picking up. recommended.

Updating this in Oct 2019 - the tour guide content is great. Looking forward to the remaining planets. Still cant beat this for the sense of scale you get when comparing the various bodies. Very enjoyable and well worth the price.
since recent updates. program will not load. never had problem before. just stays on loading screen.
review_feedback: Are you able to see which version you're running? Make sure you are on v2.5.7b or higher if you've got something like Citrix Workspace running on your PC. Not sure what else it could be, so please email me at support@drashvr.com and I'll see what I can do to help!

one_reviews_text:
Where to start? I will start with the standout feature of this program: "Flying Professor Alien" is an absolutely amazing tour guide! The man who voices the character stands out, not only for the scope of the knowledge he presents, but also for his ability to present it clearly, and with passion. This is not an actor reading a script, but an expert sharing his knowledge! I also very much enjoy how "real" his lectures are, where we can hear him breathing, and with little "mistakes" here and there, instead of typical over-production. I certainly don't mean mistakes about the knowledge, because his knowledge is impeccable, but rather moments where he might stutter, where he loses his train of thought for a few seconds, or (my favorite) when he accidentally invents a new word. To top it off, the tour guide's ability to move around and use hand gestures to point out locations on the planets really works well! All of this made for a much more personal and memorable experience than I ever expected.

The planet textures must also be singled out, not only for their educational and scientific utility, but also for their beauty. Our solar system is gorgeous!

I want to show this experience to everyone I know, so that they can enjoy the solar system as much as I do!

Devs, keep up the fantastic work!

VR is at it's best when it does one thing well, and this one is stellar (no pun intended)
You get to feel like a god holding the planets in your hand, and the sheer scale of the solar system will impress anyone with a soul.
Simply a must-buy on VR.

This is a really great app for friends of astronomy. Some may complain about the non-to scale distance between the planets, but this is also a good thing to compare the planets. There are many functions, lots of settings, you can turn on and off anything you want, it has lots of pictures and useful information. It's not a game though, but it's fun to watch, to fly around and also to learn about our solar system.
Awesome! educational and relaxing. Suitable for a didactic. Scientifically excellent. I recommend it to everybody. simple and functional, it is excellent for teaching sessions with students.

...not to mention, the layman could learn a thing or two while on the journey.  Beautifully rendered - all very well done.  This one is worthy!

I guess these things are all subjective but whoever said Spacetours was better is just flat out wrong.
Beautiful and educational, I wish I had purchased this much sooner.  Certain to be one of the VR applications I use to demonstrate the Rift from now on.
This is incredible. This is what I have been waiting for.  I am a sucker for flying around the solar system and this one is a blast at a great price.

review_title: Delivers an experience for a fair price
one_reviews_text: If you want to explore the planets in our solar system, this is a very solid way to do so. Guided tour and a few extra bells and whistles to have you revisting this app a few times. Graphics look good, creator did a nice job of scaling things so you have a good experience. Not amazing, but worth the inexpensive price ($7 USD).

review_title: Good space tour, but there's better
one_reviews_text: This is a nicely made, guided space tour of our solar system. The tour has many interesting, readable facts about our solar system.  The tour really starts to pickup once it reaches past our solar system and into the neighboring nearest stars.  The sheer enormity of it all is breath-taking and leaves you full of wonder.  Unfortunately, the graphics are the weakest part of this game and the reason why I only give it 3 stars.  Spacetours VR - Ep 1 has graphics that are more awe-inspiring than the graphical representations on this tour.  Still, this app is good value for the 50% sale price if you have any interest in an educational space tour.

This app will not launch. I've removed it, uninstalled it, reinstalled it multiple times. When launching, the app just stops responding and crashes.

I loved this on the GearVR, but I have not been able to launch this in Oculus. I've emailed the support team about a month ago and still have yet to hear back.

Would rate higher if this ever loaded properly.
review_feedback: Sorry to hear this!  I hadn't heard anything about this until now.  Just confirmed that it's working here, so I'll need to know more in order to solve your problem.  When you can, please email me at support (at) drashvr (dot) com with some details about your system and we'll go from there.

one_reviews_text:
Really enjoyed going through this.

The only things I'd like to see the developer improve quite a bit is:

A. The ship interior and player model. They look a bit unfinished/unppolished compared to the beautifully realised planets. Get someone else in to redo the model if neccessary, because with that tweak the overall visuals would be spot on. 

B. Re-do the menus. They too look a bit amateur, and while functional they could be much prettier. Even just look at what Oculus is doing with it's Home menu for an nice example of how to put a simple menu interface together.

Other than that, it's all good. :-D
Astonishing and overwhelming, one of the most elaborate and educational experiences in VR.
This is an awesome experience for kids (and adults) to learn about space. Showed it to my dad and it blow his mind.
One of the best experiences in VR. Impossible not to feel awe in the pit of your stomach. Lovingly expanded by one of the most brilliant devs in VR, Drash. A treasure!

Since the start of this era of Virtual Reality, one experience has stood out high above all others - Titans of Space.  For a great ride, for showing others space, for teaching children or adults, this app beats all others.
Not enough replay value, too short, not enough interactivity, not enough content.
A great educational VR experience that brings the planetarium home.

I  without a doubt love this experience.  It is beautiful.  The cockpit may not be as polished as it could be but really, it's not an issue.  You are paying attention to the planets anyway.  I would not hesitate to purchase this again and I definately recommened that everyone give it a try.
What can I say but this has just totally blown me away - fantastic wish I could give it more stars then five.
The superugly cockpit was in the way and made everything look like tiny balls. This was a big waste of time. Uninstalled.

review_title: Great tour of the solar system
one_reviews_text: A great tour of the solar system, with a few facts along the way. I enjoyed it and my kid *loves* it.
Thanks to the developer (DRASH).  This is a must have for anyone with VR.  Keeps getting better and better.  One of the examples you must show anyone new to VR!
This is by far the best experience I have had in VR so far.
Really good, looking forward to some narration for the icing on the cake.
Just Great!
Probably one of the experiences I have been demoing to the most people. It succeeds very well to make you feel like a tiny speck of dust. Highly recommended!
